awd_titl_txt: Targeted Infusion Project: Engagement, Retention and Innovation in Physics Instruction
awd_abstract_narration:
The Historically Black Colleges and Universities Undergraduate Program (HBCU-UP), through Targeted Infusion Projects, supports the development, implementation, and study of evidence-based innovative models and approaches for improving the preparation and success of HBCU undergraduate students so that they may pursue science, technology, engineering or mathematics (STEM) graduate programs and/or careers. The project at the University of Maryland Eastern Shore seeks to enhance undergraduate physics education by implementing innovative, yet evidence-based strategies and activities to teach physics. The project includes a strong plan for formative and summative evaluation.

This project has the goal to improve student engagement in physics classrooms by introducing peer-to-peer instruction, by synchronization between labs and lectures, by using a non-traditional approach as an engagement tool through novel instructional materials, and by integrating the materials to clicker questions for real-time, in-class feedback and assessment of learning outcomes. The project establishes a faculty and graduate teaching assistants training program in active learning methods in group settings; implements active learning techniques in selected physics courses;  creates a pool of culturally and scientifically relevant clicker questions to enhance both engagement and critical thinking; and measures the effects of implementation and challenges as they arise. This project will serve as a case study on how to implement evidence-based teaching methods in the setting of this institution, which can then serve as a model at other institutions of similar mission and size.
org_div_long_name: Div. of Equity for Excellence in STEM

por.por_cntn:
Sustained flow of innovation is the key to the prosperity of any knowledge-based economy. To create a steady pipeline of next-gen problem solvers and innovators we need to address three main challenges: 1) enhancement of critical thinking ability of students; 2) student engagement in relevant hands-on activities through active learning, and 3) student involvement in exciting modular frontline research projects. 

In this project we have addressed these challenges and found pathways to create a pool of next generation STEM leaders and creative problem solvers by initiating group discussions and critical thinking via custom drawn cartoon clicker questions, followed by creating hands-on labs to resolve critical misconceptions. These students were then introduced to curiosity driven front line research projects to get involved in cutting-edge research.

Outcome of these activities are: 

Peer reviewed publications:

J1. Ouro-Koura, Habilou, Ayobami Ogunmolasuyi, Othman Suleiman, Isaac Omodia, Jaylah Easter, Yasmin Roye, and Kausik S. Das. "Boundary Condition Induced Passive Chaotic Mixing in Straight Microchannels." Physics of Fluids (Letters) 34(5), 051703 (2022). https://aip.scitation.org/doi/pdf/10.1063/5.0088014

J2. Barnes, Benjamin K., Habilou Ouro-Koura, Justin Derickson, Samuel Lebarty, Jesudara Omidokun, Nathan Bane, Othman Suleiman et al. "Plasma generation by household microwave oven for surface modification and other emerging applications." American Journal of Physics 89, no. 4 (2021): 372-382. (Editor's Pick, Most downloaded paper in 2021, Featured by MIT Technology Review).

J3. M. Nazari, S. Nazifi, Z. Huang, T. Tong, H. Ouro-Koura, J. Bao, K. S Das, and H. Ghasemi, Surface Tension Nanogates for Controlled Ion Transport. ACS Applied Nano Materials.ACS Appl. Nano Mater. 2020, 3, 7, 6979?6986 (Journal Cover Article).

J4. Barnes B, Elkholy I, Bane N, Derickson J, Das KS. Laser Scribed Graphene/Polymer composites: A Possible Verification of Carbon Nano-Coil Inductors. Current Applied Physics. 2020 Jun 14. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cap.2020.06.008 (Featured by Elsevier).

J5. Barnes, Benjamin Kerr, and Kausik S. Das. "Resistance Switching and Memristive Hysteresis in Visible-Light-Activated Adsorbed ZnO Thin Films." Scientific reports 8.1 (2018): 2184. https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-018-20598-5, (Top 25 articles in Physics in 2018).

Provisional Patent

Das, KS and Barnes, BK. Photo-Induced Ethanol Adsorbed Metal Oxide Memristor. United States Patent application, US 62/670594, 2018.

Book Chapter

Kausik S Das, Microbial fuel cells: a path to green, renewable energy. In Practices and Perspectives in Sustainable Bioenergy, 2020 (pp. 195-206). Springer, https://doi.org/10.1007/978-81-322-3965-9_9

Zero gravity payload

Video of the zero-g experiment: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TX5hPMEhjdY

Modified by: Kausiksankar Das
